page.title: 02ORIGIN OF NAME WIVELISCOMBE
page.content:
The name Wiveliscombe,mentioned in the original Domesday Book,is pronounced stressing the "is" syllable. Among the locals the town is called "Wivey", or the older name of "Wilscombe".
Wiveliscombe has been spelt in many different ways: Wyfelescumbe, Wivelescomb, Wyvelescomb, and so on. Archbishop Mepham came to Wiveliscombe in 1331, and Walter de Hemingford,in recording the visit, could not master the name. He called it Wenelliscombe, Wemblishcumbe, Wynescombe, and at last Wivescombe.
It is said that the name Wiveliscombe refers to the combe (or valley) which became possession of an English chief called Wifela or Wyvel, when his tribe settled here (Wifela's Combe).
